item.title: Litter in Church House Gardens by a bin, 18th September
item.description:

item.title: Pavement gullies along Crown Lane , BR2 9PJ, 18th September
item.description:
Gullies on the pavement near property's need a good clean some have weeds in, some have piles of dirt in which are now being used by dogs.These gullies were put in to help drain excess water from the pavement, cannot for the life of me understand why they are not cleaned out on a regular basis.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Lane, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped vehicle no MOT blocking access/exit, 18th September
item.description:

item.title: Fluorescent Lamp and Rubbish Dumped on Wheathill Road â€“ Safety Risk, 18th September
item.description:
A fluorescent lamp, plastic crate, and black rubbish bag have been dumped on the pavement at Wheathill Road. The lamp in particular is hazardous, as it can shatter and release toxic materials, posing a serious danger to pedestrians and children. This hotspot is now a clear health and safety risk, and urgent removal plus enforcement action are essential.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wheathill Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
